comments.author: Jirayu.5834
comments.body:
Lawton Campbell.8517:

You’ll need an API key for each guild member to get that data from the API. I’m not sure what the game client shows.

In game, sometimes it show server when mouse-hover on member name and sometimes not. I still wonder how this works.

Anyway, You can check member homeworld in leaderboard on gw2 website as Chaba suggest

comments.author: Chaba.5410
comments.body:
You can see this also from the Achievement Points leaderboard. Filter by guild.

https://leaderboards.guildwars2.com/en/na/achievements

comments.author: Lawton Campbell.8517
comments.body: You’ll need an API key for each guild member to get that data from the API. I’m not sure what the game client shows.

comments.author: Unixx.2309
comments.body:
Hello, i will keep it short.

Is there a option the see the guild member(s) home world (/v2/guild/:id/members)? Or is it only available from the members api key (/v2/account)?

When you go in to the character screen in game you can see friends and there home world. Is there a option for guilds as well?

Thanks in advance,
